result.execSummary:
The defendant Mitchell B Vogelman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law.  Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Attend school daily and complete daily assignments.  Once high school education is complete, obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any narcotic drugs of any kind, even with a prescription.

Defendant must attend 3 self-help meetings per week and provide signed proof of attendance.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

records.addlTxt: Defendant does not plan on seeking postconviction relief.
Sentencing hearing on November 11, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Mitchell B Vogelman in court with attorney Erin J. Larsen.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.
Upon plea to 14CF289, Ct 5, bal DRI. State recommends probation, ss on amount. 14CF848, Pl to 2 BJ, 3rd BJ DRI. Agreed not to issue BJ from June, 2014. The State will be asking for stayed jail time. Parties free to argue.
P-G to all
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense is asking that bond be modified to allow defendant to work as a car salesman and remove GPS or allow deft to work in said employment. The State indicates that the State agreed to said request before and that's when deft picked up bail jumping charges. The State objects.

BTC: guilty. PSI ordered.  Bond to be modified - deft is to go to 3 self help groups per week. Deft must bring signed proof that he attends and he must provide proof to ZCI. GPS to be removed. Other conditions remain.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Same bond conditions as case 14CF289.  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol or controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).  Exceptions are attending court dates and meeting with attorney.  Defendant may work for Vector Company from the hours of 8AM to 4PM Monday through Friday.  Defendant must keep a log as to where he goes for said employment and proved to ZCI on a weekly basis.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 08/22/2014 - GPS MAY BE REMOVED. DEFENDANT MUST ATTEND 3 SELF HELP GROUPS PER WEEK AND BRING SIGNED PROOF OF ATTENDANCE TO ZCI WEEKLY.
Defendant's
E. Larsen
Status conference on August 22, 2014 at 09:00 am.
NG plea entered.
